Incident_Command_System_(ICS).text:
An Incident Command System (ICS) is designed to allow for coordination of response to an MCI by providing for an integrated organizational/command structure
[3]
ICS has been in use since the 1970's.
Designed to expand or contract in size in response to scope of incident.
After the September 11, 2001 terrorist attacks, the Department of Homeland Security proposed the National Incident Management System (NIMS) in response to perceived deficiencies in coordination between emergency responders.
[4]
NIMS mandates the use of ICS in the United States for MCI response
